newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Gazprom plans $1 bln Eurobond, $1 bln convertible.
newsitem.headline: Gazprom plans $1 bln Eurobond, $1 bln convertible.

text.p: Russian gas monopoly RAO Gazprom plans to issue a $1 billion Eurobond and a $1 billion convertible bond during 1997 or early 1998, the company said in a statement on Friday.

It said ABN Amro and Goldman Sachs would work on the eurobond issue, but did not say in what capacity. Gazprom said it had named ABN Amro as a consultant on the eurobond issue rating, but gave no further details.

Gazprom said a programme to raise credit envisaged both non-secured and secured loans. The $1 billion Eurobond and the $1 billion convertible bond were both included in the non-secured loan programme, it said.
Gazprom, the world's largest gas producer, has already issued American Depositary Shares, which allow foreign trading of its equity.
